labels.analysis: The MCP Server described specializes in floating-point computations with tools tailored for comparing and analyzing item (skin) data in a market context. The core functionality revolves around numerical precision and quick access to statistical information like float values and prices for market items, suggesting a focus on financial analysis, trading metrics, and data comparison in the gaming/collectibles space.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Financial Services" covers the core function of analyzing and comparing item prices and floored values, which aligns with market value assessment. The secondary labels "Web Search & Research" and "Database Operations" reflect the server's ability to query and retrieve data efficiently. No custom label is needed as predefined categories adequately capture the functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: CSFloat
server_info_crawled.author: @RodrigoCorreia23/csfloat2
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide a high-performance, customizable floating-point computation environment for scientific and engineering applications. Enable precise and efficient numerical calculations with flexible precision settings. Enhance computational workflows with robust and optimized floating-point operations.

tools.name: search_skins
tools.description: Deploy Server @RodrigoCorreia23/csfloat2 Try in Playground search_skins

tools.name: get_skin_float
tools.description: Retorna o menor float ativo para um skin (market_hash_name).

tools.name: get_skin_price
tools.description: Retorna o menor preço ativo para um skin, convertido de cents.

tools.name: compare_skins
tools.description: Compara float e preço entre dois skins.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@RodrigoCorreia23/csfloat2/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
